name: Villiam
text: Gipson Heating and air conditioning is the BEST. I just moved to a house and needed my gas heat turned on. To do so I needed an inspection and pressure test. Without any luck from multiple companies I reached out to, and a few let downs from companies that said they could help (but canceled last minute) called Gipson. And he was able to pull a permit and set everything up for the next day! I should have called Gipson first! Shane (the man who came to my house) was honest, insightful, and very professional. Because of Gipson I was able to get my heat turned on that same day! Gipson will be the only company I will recommend for Heating and air  from this point. Thank you very much!

resp.text: Thanks for the review!

name: Tim Brice
text: Gipson Heating and Air is a very capable, experienced family-owned business with multiple skill sets.   We have used them to replace our main single stage heat cooling system and they also came back to make repairs at no charge.   They also replaced our water heater on very short notice at a great price.   Their techs are always courteous and clean, wearing booties every time they come inside, and they work fast without a lot of chit-chat.   We are indebted to them and would highly recommend them as a trade company with high skills and equal integrity.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review! So glad to have you as a customer!

name: PJ Simmons
text: Shane was incredibly helpful in getting my heating system going again. He clearly has been doing this for long enough to home right in on the problem. He has restored my faith in service companies with his honesty and professionalism.

resp.text: Happy to help out! Thanks for the review!

name: greg honeycutt
text: Fast, professional with amazing service and people. I would highly recommend Gipson for all of your hvac needs.

resp.text: Thank you sir!

name: Alesha Price
text: I can’t say enough about Shane and his amazing crew. We had him come out a few months ago to repair our HVAC system. He did a wonderful job fixing it after the company who installed it really messed it up. I thought we were having problems with the same system again because water randomly began leaking through our ceiling which is what had happened in the past, so my first thought was, “Uh-oh, the air conditioner is malfunctioning again.” So I called Shane to check it out and it turned out to be our hot water heater. First of all, he answered my call on a weekend when he was doing other things on his own time and made our problem a priority to fix, which I truly appreciate. And instead of referring me out to someone else to deal with it since it wasn’t an HVAC issue, he came out and replaced it himself and made modifications to ensure it could never leak through the ceiling again. Also, he discovered in the process that a faulty valve had malfunctioned on the outside of our house and was causing extraordinary water pressure on the inside, which had cost us thousands of dollars in repairs and appliance replacement, (including the water heater!), over the years! No one had ever been so thorough as to investigate something as simple but as impactful as the water pressure in our home, (and we had other big companies come out over the years). But Shane did and he even fixed that issue- spending literally hours digging out and replacing the broken valve in our front yard. We are so thankful that Shane was there to help us out. They really are jacks of all trades at Gipson Heating and Air Conditioning and are truly knowledgeable about many things across the board in terms of repairs. I have since referred others to Shane and Co with full confidence that he and his crew will always do the job right for a fair price, without taking advantage of people in the process, and will go above and beyond in the quality of their product and services.  And that, in and of itself, is worth more than anything to me. I do truly appreciate these fine people and cannot say enough good things about this company.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the kind words! It’s truly our pleasure to go above and beyond for our customers.

name: Katie Vick
text: Gipson Heating and Air Conditioning LLC did a great job installing our new system! We got quotes from multiple people and went with Gipson. We got the most for our money with them and they were really great! We will use them in the future for all of our heating and cooling needs!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the review!

name: Prayer Warrior Princess
text: I cannot say enough about Shane- owner of Gipson Heating and Air Conditioning. In order to give a better understanding of my situation let me say, without the intent of trashing anyone or their business, that when our system was replaced two years ago by the company that installed it, (who I also called for help yesterday when it stopped working), it malfunctioned quickly and flooded a bedroom ruining drywall and requiring extensive repairs. Eventually it had to be completely replaced as it never functioned properly. The replacement system needed a few tweaks, but eventually it seemed to work consistently and well and did for nearly a year- until yesterday. So, I contacted the company who installed the system and they were unable to come out immediately, nor could they give me a timeframe for their arrival.  It was 80 degrees inside, I have pets, and I needed someone there sooner rather than later. Shane wasted no time in getting to my house to assess the system and set to work immediately. In the process, he educated me on the system and gave me a complete rundown of what exactly was wrong, including a list of issues caused by the installers of the system, which were contributing to the malfunction of it. He also hauled off a large garbage bag of trash that the installers left in my attic! Additionally, his service charges were so reasonable I actually questioned him about it! His reply was basically that he would rather be good to customers, charge reasonably and fairly, and get great reviews and referrals than charge exorbitant amounts of money for his services! I was blown away! Now my air is working beautifully, I didn’t spend a fortune to get it fixed, and he has a customer for LIFE. Try Gipson Heating and Air Conditioning. Their work ethic, professionalism, quality work product, and positive results speak for themselves!

resp.text: Our pleasure to help and thanks so much for the review!

name: Cohen Johnson
text: Shane diagnosed and fixed a problem with our gas logs. Highly recommend Shane!

resp.text: Thanks so much!

name: Ashley
text:
First, let me mention that I have never written a review for any company or even a product I've purchased and loved from Amazon but Gipson Heating & Air Conditioning deserves a review.  I don't even know where to begin because they are so AMAZING.  The owner of this company literally has the key code to my front door because he is so trustworthy.  I wouldn't hesitate to let him babysit my children because he is such a great guy.  His staff as well.  My story is unique because what started with me calling him out to talk about a duct cleaning turned into my husband and I gutting our entire home for a remodel (for other reasons) and we wanted a brand new system.  Shane came out to do a load calculation to help us pick the perfect system.  He was so detailed that he climbed into the smallest, most cringy area underneath a stairway landing in my basement. I felt like I was watching the show Fear Factor because you couldn't have paid me to crawl under there!!  We sat down at the table and he explained with so much detail the system I needed.  What I found to be so funny, is that I have never met a HVAC guy that was so passionate about his work.  I thought I was going to have to kick him out because, at one point, I think he started doing algebra equations based on how many windows I have and insulation in the house and whether the sun rises or sets on backside of my roof...LOL.

Anyways,  this remodel has taken two years and I don't know how many times he came out to my home to help me before I ever paid him a dime.  I have a longer chain of text messages to him than I do to some of my friends.  He has just been there to answer every...single...one of my questions. I have a beautiful new HVAC system now, all new ductwork, gas lines for my hot water heater and two fireplaces and an additional ductless, mini split system installed.  There is not a better, more skilled, or more honest HVAC company in this area....period!!

resp.text: Thanks so much Ashley for the nice review!

name: Whitney Mosley
text: Shane and his team went above and beyond to make sure my family was taken care of before we needed heat for winter. They always arrive promptly and ready to work. We appreciate the excellent customer service that Shane and his team exhibits. They are always quick to respond with any questions we may have.

resp.text: Our pleasure! Thank you

text:
"I would like to say if I could give Gipson Heating & Air Conditioning more than five stars I would! They did such a professional, neat, and clean job! When I had my home built, they put my hot water tank inside the unfinished portion of the basement. It was clearly a space for the tank in the garage. Well, Shane and his crew at Gipson Heating & Air Conditioning came through with the MAGNIFICENT save! They moved the tank and the vent with no problem! EFFORTLESSLY! Thanks again for the SPECTACULAR SERVICE! I definitely have someone I can call on for ALL my HVAC needs now! I would also RECOMMEND them to anyone in need of their services!"

Per my hubby Glenn

text: Gipson replaced both HVAC units, rebuilt ductwork, and replaced vents at my home this summer, and the entire experience was fantastic. The results have been amazing - the air is so much cleaner in my house, the smart thermostats and related phone app are so helpful and convenient, and the temperature control is precise and feels great. text: Shane replaced both our main unit and the unit upstairs, replaced old duct work, and added duct work where needed to handle the air flow. They did a great job. They were friendly, clean, and showed pride in their work.

name: Karla Keplinger
text: We had another company come out last Thursday to fix our hot water heater. They had to “order a part” Friday morning and it would be here Saturday for them to come fix it today (Monday). After no call from the other company today, we called them for them to inform us that the part would not be here until tomorrow (Tuesday). So we are stranded from Thursday-Tuesday without hot water. A friend recommended Gipson so we called them around 10:00 and told them about our situation. They were on another job but managed to find our part, pick it up and come fix our issue around 5:00 today. The same day!!!! I can’t thank them enough. They were so nice and explained everything. I would recommend them to anybody. Great job guys!!

resp.text: I’m so glad we were able to help! Thanks for the review!

name: Traci Miller
text:
Update - I originally posted my review 11 months ago. We have since moved and our air conditioner in our current home went out on us a couple of weeks ago. I called Gipson Heating & Air late one day and they were out the next morning as agreed upon. Within the next hour Shane had our unit up and running like new! This is a dependable company that will be honest with you and won't overcharge you! I will definitely call them when I need them again!!!

Shane, Sean, Evan and Trevor with Gipson Heating and Air Conditioning are the best!! They always take care of us in the least expensive way. Their customer service is excellent, and I know when I call them I do not have to worry...they will get things handled!!

resp.text: Thanks for the review and the nice review!

name: Jerri Turner
text: The Gipson crew, Shane, Trevor, Anthony, and Evan did a fantastic job. They are courteous,  professional, hard working young men. Shane did a thorough check of the house and the faulty equipment and then determined how to efficiently replace heating and air units and the dilapidated duct work and did for less than other providers. I had 3 quotes, 2 if which did not even include all  the duct work and new return vent.  I would recommend Gipson Heating & Air to anyone needing repairs or replacement. They are the best.

resp.text: Thank you for the review! We appreciate you very much!

name: Barry
text:
The quality, value, professionalism, responsiveness and dependability options in this survey all apply to Gipson Heating and Air but honesty is what I like most about this company. They have Serviced my 15 year old home unit for two years now and have never tried to sell me a new unit. Shane (the owner) always says he can keep it running with routine service and by topping off the freon at the beginning of each summer. He recommends this as it is cheaper for me and the best option with kids in college and a new unit is not needed right now. Previous HVAC companies pitched the need for a new unit based on age before even inspecting it.

But when it comes time for a new unit, as it was when Gipson replaced the 30+ year old unit in our rental house this summer, it was another positive experience with this company. Shane checked the unit, explained why this unit could not be repaired (it had rusted through in many areas) and recommended the best and most affordable unit for replacement. He even set me up with financing which allowed for payoff in six months with no interest.

It’s a very vulnerable feeling when you have problems that you don’t fully understand and feel like you are at the mercy of the repair tech’s information. I don’t have this feeling with Gipson as they take the time to explain and actually show you what the problem is before making the repair (Shane sent pictures to me at work when a fan motor needed replacing during last summer’s service).

I cannot recommend this company enough strictly based on their honesty and work ethics.

resp.text: Thanks for the review and your trust in us!

name: Taylor Nguyen
text:
Super impressed & satisfied with Gipson Heating & Air.
Very professional, impeccable response time, and quality work! Thanks so much y’all 👍🏼

resp.text: Thanks for the review and the opportunity to help out!

name: Myra Hunter
text: If I could give six stars -- even seven -- I would! They replaced all the duct work in my crawlspace and planned the work in such a way that I did not have to go a single sleepless night without my AC running. Thorough, fast, efficient, professionals at a fair price. They provided additional solutions for my indoor air-return grid and oddly designed bathroom wall vent cover, and even solved a vexing gas valve problem with my antique 1957 Caloric Ultramatic wall oven. Best experience I've ever had with contractors of any kind.  Happy to HIGHLY RECOMMEND Shane Gipson and his crew. I should also point out that my HVAC unit is cooling the house better than ever with sparkling clean air, now that my new duct work matches the output capacity of my unit.

resp.text: Thanks so much for the opportunity and trust in us to work with you on this project! Thanks

name: Patti Harrison
text: Shane and Anthony were great. They were on time explained what they were doing. Very knowledgeable and professional. I would use them again.

I met Shane when I needed a 2nd opinion on my furnace just after having someone prior come and try to sell me a new furnace along with other things I didn't need. He's shown integrity as well as how knowledgeable he is in this field by fixing only what needs to be fixed and explaining what will be necessary for maintenance. I am glad to know these guys and to know this quality of service can still be found.

name: Tyler Wilbanks
text: I have used Gipson Heating & Air on several different occasions over the past year. The first time they came out, I had them do a standard service on the A/C unit. They did a fantastic job! They took before and after pictures and explained everything they did in detail. I was so impressed by their service I canceled my home warranty the next day so I could exclusively use Shane and his crew to take care of any heating and A/C needs I may have in the future. Most recently, they did a complete furnace replacement and even helped with the financing through our local utility company. They gave me three options of furnaces with upfront pricing and held true to their quote. They worked for 2 and a half days in the rain to make sure that we would have heat ahead of the cold front. Again, they took photos of their work along the way and went above and beyond what was required of them for the install. I cannot express how satisfied we have been working with Shane and his team at Gipson Heating and Air. If you are in the market for any Heating & Air services, stop your search and call Gipson, you will not be disappointed!

My heat had been out for a week since thanksgiving. My apartment complex took several days to even respond, and even then their maintenance guy didn't even want to mess with it. These guys came all the way to Huntsville to replace my unit. Not only were they  friendly with my whole household,  but also considerate and kind enough to fix small things like the wooden support in my closet where the AC unit and water heater set, as well as the thermostat barely hanging in the drywall. They thoroughly made sure heat and air were functioning properly, and even cleaned up after themselves which was probably my favorite part.
Much appreciated again, guys.

name: Kathleen McBride
text: Shane and his crew are the best!  Friendly, honest, and they know what they are doing.  Fantastic job every time.  I recommend them to everyone and they are the only ones I call for HVAC and more.

name: Colson Wagoner
text:
I reached out to Shane Gipson for a second opinion/quote after another local company came to do maintenance and said I needed to replace my 5 year old AC unit. Unlike most other companies, Mr. Gipson was willing to accommodate my work schedule and came at 7am so I would not have to leave work.

He was on time and nothing but professional from the start. He quickly identified the issue with the AC unit (the same one that was supposed to require a new unit) and got the AC up and running within 20 minutes. To top it off the price charged for the work done was more than reasonable.

After completing the job Mr. Gipson stayed and thoroughly cleaned the unit and sent me before and after pictures showing the work performed. The customer service and professional care shown was above and beyond all expectations.

I cannot say enough about the honesty, professionalism, and quality of this company. Will have my business so long as I am in the area.

resp.text: Thank you! So happy to help you out!

name: Brooks Wall
text: They are talented, hard working and most important, they are honest which means you will only pay for what you need.  Shane has done work for me on past homes as well as rental property and I’ve always been impressed at how professional he is.

name: R Burnley
text: These guys installed 2 mini split units for us.  There was a miscommunication between us and they thought I had cancelled. They ran conduit for our wires that would be unsightly without it.  We did not expect this and when they got through they cleaned up after themselves. name: Christopher Stanfield
text:
Shane and the team at Gipson Heating and Air are true masters and perfectionists of their craft.

Don’t waste your time trying to find someone that can do what Shane does down the the science at which he does it at.  He has put in the hours, and he is always up-to-date on the latest in his industry.

I hired Shane and his team to come behind someone else who did the HVAC on my new home because something didn’t seem right.  Shane very quickly responded to my phone call, he scheduled a time to meet with me, showed up on time, did a thorough evaluation and load calculation of my system, and explained the solution to the problem and how the solution would benefit my family, home, and wallet.

Shane and his team were not just in an out of my home as fast as possible while trying to sell me something I did not need like most companies.  They took their time, did the job right the first time, and even cleaned up behind themselves so well it was like they were never at my home.

Call Shane!

name: maranda knox
text: Best heating and air guys around! We are super pleased with their fast response and great work. We highly recommend them to family and friends all of the time!

name: Ashley Robertson
text: It’s not often that I post reviews on businesses but I absolutely had to review these guys! I’ve NEVER worked with a company so professional and prompt! These guys not only KNOW THEIR STUFF, they explain the findings/process in a way that those of us who are less HVAC inclined can actually understand. Even more...they’re affordable! They did an inspection on a home my husband and I are in the process of purchasing. They were there at the exact time they said they would be. They were very efficient. They took pictures of everything and explained to us their findings while showing us the photos! They also sent those photos to us with the inspection report so that there would be no doubts when we sent that same report to the sellers to request repairs. These guys have great communication and they just seem like genuinely good people! A day or so after, when we had received our report and they had been paid (and we didn’t expect to hear from them again until we had more hvac needs) I received a message from them just informing us that the seller had contacted them to price repairs. This was not something they had to do, but they did it anyway. Like I said, they’re just genuinely  good guys! I’ve boasted about them to anyone who will listen. They truly went above and beyond what we expected. I read reviews before purchasing ANYTHING so I know how important these reviews are to future customers! Listen...book these guys! You absolutely won’t regret it! I’ll use them from now on!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Ashley!

name: Debbie Maddox
text: My husband and I used Shane to help prepare our home to be sold recently. We were very well pleased with the professionalism of the crew and their knowledge of HVAC. They were fast and efficient in completing the work we need to be done. We Had a contract on our house in 5 days. We will call on Shane Gipson again if needed in our new home. Thanks Shane and crew.

resp.text: Thanks! We are blessed to have you as a customer.

name: Civil Ops, Consulting
text: Shane and his team went above and beyond to help us create a solution to replace our outside unit. He thoroughly explained every issue with our unit and gave us every possible option to fix it.  Highly recommended!

name: Donna Gabriel
text:
I have had many experiences with HVAC personnel over the years. I’ve been a homeowner for 26 years and am on my second Trane heat pump system.
It would not be an exaggeration to say that Gipson Heating & Air Conditioning gave me the most thorough service I’ve received in those 26 years. They not only performed the seasonal maintenance on my unit, but discovered and remedied additional problems. They even corrected mistakes made by previous contractors which could have led to a malfunction of my unit in the future.
(One example: I had been dealing with a condensation problem in my air handler and Shane Gipson explained why it was happening and fixed it immediately. By the way, the condensation was caused by the omission of an important step which another company’s rep had not bothered to return my call on, much less offer to remedy.)
Shane Gipson’s knowledge and expertise was surpassed only by his willingness to go above and beyond what he initially came to do. And he patiently answered all my questions (I had many).
I urge you to give Gipson Heating & Air a call when you next need maintenance work or repair on your heating/air unit, no matter the brand. You will not be disappointed. In fact, you may be amazed that there are still those who have such a work ethic and hold themselves to such a high standard. And you will be left with peace of mind, knowing that no stone was left unturned in the care of your system. I thank Shane and Shawn for their impeccable service.

resp.text: This really means a lot to us and we thank you for giving us the opportunity! Thanks so much for the review!

name: Brandon Dowd
text: Shane and his guys were great. They were very knowledgeable and went above and beyond to make sure we were happy! Highly recommend.

resp.text: Glad you guys are happy with new system!

name: Gregory Smith
text:
After nearly 40 years of homeownership, can say without a doubt that working with Gipson Heating & Air was one of our best experiences. Knowing we had two 20 year old HVAC systems, we were faced with replacing both systems. As a result, we did our due diligence to obtain quotes, which sadly took over a month to get three that were actually apples-to-apples .

We were nearly ready to pull the trigger when we came across Gipson. Not only did we get a quote FAST, but their quote was incredibly detailed; including sketches of our ductwork. In retrospect, this wasn't a big surprise, since Gipson actually did a full, comprehensive review, well beyond the cursory inspections the others did. Gipson asked questions the others didn't, revealed critical items the others missed, and provided additional details that truly benefited us. Their best suggestion was flipping a horizontal system to vertical. Yhis change gave us a tremendous amount of additional attic space, a genuine bonus!

We could go on singing Gipson's praises but will wrap up by simply saying all work was performed exactly as quoted, the installation was top notch, was done as promised and on time. If you need HVAC work done, one call is all you will need - and that's to Gipson.

resp.text: It was our pleasure working with you guys! Thanks so much for the kind words and review!

name: Susan Sharp
text: Great job!  Shawn and Trevor are polite, friendly and professional!  Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thanks very much for the review!

name: Lorena Jordan
text: Very professional and knowledgeable. They know what they are doing. Very reasonable price!

resp.text: Thanks! We’re so glad you are happy with new system and now have better airflow throughout the home!

name: Heather Owens
text: Fast, quick, efficient, and respectful. Communicates well and friendly. Will use again!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the opportunity and the review!

name: Jacob Lucus
text:
My sister had them come out to replace her entire heat and air conditioning system.  She received a few quotes from companies and although Gibson was not the lowest they were the most professional and were willing and able to do the entire job and not leave a whole in the wall to be fixed by another contractor she would have to pay.
I agreed to stay at her home so she would not need to take a day off work and we wanted someone at the house incase there was a problem or questions that they needed to check with us before doing.
The owner showed up a few minutes before the agreed on time which was before his normal business hours because my sister asked if he could start early so I would not have to say there all day.  By 9 am he had already removed the old unit and started getting the new unit ready to install.  When his employees arrived they immediately came up to me and introduced themselves.  The two employees were clean and neatly dressed.
While working they took the time to clean as they went never leaving a mess or tools laying around.  I watched the entire crew (owner included) and they all worked very well together and each of them seemed to care about the job as the owner.  All would answer any questions I had and were more polite than I can ever get my children to be.  I requested some very minor changes to the was a drain line ran and they immediately agreed and said it would not charge the price.
When they were done all their work looked so neat, clean, and organized.  They went back with my sister and me both explaining everything they did and why they did it.  They went over what she had asked them to do and made sure she was happy with everything.  While working he also found a few other things that were not up to code that he fixed to bring everything around the unit up to the latest codes.  While the owner was doing all this his employees were cleaning everything they were even near.  They vacuumed a carpet that had probably not been vacuumed in a long while and swept out the entire garage.
When it came time to pay he said he already told her the price.  My sister asked about any extra costs and the owner explained that he does not believe in changing the price after agreeing to the job and any extra cost that occurs he absorbs.
In my opinion these were some of the very best contractors I have ever been around working in my home or someone else's.  All the employees seemed to enjoy their job and the company they worked for.  Great job all of you.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words! We’re glad you guys are happy with new Trane system!

name: Biju Nair
text:
Right from the beginning Shane exhibited very professional and courteous behavior. When he visited to give a quote for the A/C replacement, he thoroughly checked the existing system, measured the rooms for the size needed, wiped existing system clean and gave us good advise on maintaining vs replacing.

After I did my research of getting wire from 8 contractors, I found that Gipson's quote was midway from others. So when I mentioned that to him, he agreed on a quote that was amicable. He bought the system that I recommended Trane XR14, after my research and did a great job with the installation.

It was the best service ever with Shane sharing a ton of information about the system and it's maintenance. He was very courteous, caring and respectful and thanked us several times for the business. Overall, I'll definitely recommend him for everything technical to being amiable.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your trust in us! It has been our pleasure.

text: You guys were great from start to finish

name: Lauren

name: Ken Bryars
text: Came home from church to a warm house ... air running but not cooling. Called Island Air (on a Sunday) ... the technician called to let me know he had me in his queue ... would be there in about an hour. Came and discovered a small frog had grounded the capacitor in the outside unit which fried the capacitor and frog. Replaced the capacitor, and had my A/C back up and running. Island Air exceeded my expectation, and was very pleased with the timely service and quick diagnostic/repair ... I give them 5 stars!

name: Patty King
text: As always, quality workmanship. The gentleman explained what he had done, and why.   Will use again and recommend to others.  Thank you.

name: Blake Norris
text: Our 21 year old ac bit the dust in July and the crew at Island Air had us up and running within 48 hours of us contacting them. They had quite a few options available to us that they walked us through the process. The unit they installed has been going strong for a year now. It controls humidity so we don’t keep the air as low as we used to which saves $$ on the power bill.  Professional and expeditious. Would recommend them to anyone!

name: Eric Bradley
text: Showed up when we couldn’t find anyone else to get serviced. Technician was there within a couple hours and fixed the problem and had great suggestions for future problems. Great experience!

text: Very prompt with regard to appointment time.  Technician was very polite and knowledgeable.  Researched system to identify problem as well as other, non critical item that was not impacting system performance at present or in future. Still dropping. It was an awful night. Slept with the back door open and 3 ceiling fans running continuously. Never take cool/cold air for granted in the summertime at the beach!
Both young men were sympathetic, friendly, and professional. Would recommend Island Air to anyone. They were recommended to me by a neighbor.

He found moisture build up, black gunk, growing. We immediately requested him to install a filtration system, that he recommended. This will kill any growth and filter the air.  A definite plus when you have a lung condition!  We are very appreciative that Island  Air Employees are well trained, kind, efficient,  and care about their customers!! tonight!!

Tom and Paula Pierce

name: Renee Willie
text:
This company was hired to inspect the ac in my home prior to moving in. I was told it was all in working order.
The inspection was done on February 5th. I moved in on February 14th. I called today, April 27th bc the air is not cooling in part of the house. It didn't even begin to get hot until a few weeks ago and the part of the house that never cools is the guest area.
So, after being here a few weeks and having a guest stay and tell me how hot it is, I call to ask Island Air to see what is the problem, since they were the ones who said it worked great.
Well, of course, they won't come out and inspect without paying Another fee!😡
Needless to say, don't trust their word because evidently it is no good. Now I have an ac unit that does not work properly, after they told me it did. And, I have to pay someone to fix it!!😡😡😡
Great Company there, NOT!

name: Leigh Scott
text:
We are building a new house. Our building contractor recommended Island Air-Air Conditioning and Heating, Gulf Shores, AL. My husband and I previously lived in several homes with HVAC problems stemming from poor design and installations. We knew we wanted to avoid those with new construction.

I initially met with Rob Barnas of Island Air to explain our HVAC desires. Rob and Chris designed a plan to address the "wants & needs" of our system. It's very easy to install flexible ducts improperly, but Eddie and the men ran the ducts and attached the air handlers with great care.

New HVAC systems are very expensive. I did not want to buy a new system and suffer the same issues that we had to pay to have repaired in previous houses. So, throughout the construction process I asked dozens of questions.  I'm sure this was tiresome for Island Air, but they were very patient with me. Honestly, how can anyone be expected to properly operate and care for a system unless they understand how it's supposed to work? Hahahaha. Also, I wanted to understand the system while I could still see the components. Our drywall is not up yet. We are now 4 months into construction, so not far enough along to have thermostats installed or have the system turned on. However, we are enough along for me to say I am happy this far with the work done by Island Air of Gulf Shores, AL. I will try to post again after we move in to give everyone a final report on how it feels to live in an HVAC system built by Island Air.

PS. In case you are wondering. I am not related by blood or personal connections to anyone at Island Air and have received no discounts or other incentives for posting this review.
D. Scott
Gulf Shores, AL

name: Nautical Star
text: My first experience with this company was in 2014 when I asked them to install an AC system to my downstairs add on.  The initial job was well done.  I was happy with the work that I entered a service agreement for my upstairs unit. In 2016 my trust with the company was severely damaged when the AC tech charged me for the part that was still under warranty and I had to call them on it.  To the company credit, they did "refund" me with the credit on the next repair job in the spring of 2017.  I paid the invoice without examining it carefully as I should have done.  Two months in late May of 2017, I received a letter from the Baldwin County small claim court saying that Island  Air is suing me for nonpayment.  I called them and the manager told me that all this can go away if I pay them at that point.  I went home and dug up all my paperwork and found out that they overcharged me once again on the visit in spring 2017.  I faxed them my receipts and called them the next day and advised them not to go ahead with the lawsuit because they will not win in court.  They rescinded the the court claim and offered me a six month maintenance complimentary service for my inconvenience,  but after all the shenanigans I have to walk away.  The trust factor is no longer there.  I waited for four months to write this review to make sure that my emotion is in check and to give them a fair review about my experience with the company.   Take home points?  Save your receipts and you need to know about the warranty your AC system.  Always go check the charges line by line and make sure to keep this company honest.  They will take advantage of your ignorance.

text: We have used Hansen a few times now ranging from checking out and servicing the unit at our current house to completely replacing the central unit at our old house. Very professional and we have zero complaints. HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to everyone I know when they need HVAC work done.

name: Rosemary Lowe
text: Placing review to register for the contest

name: Carmen Gooden
text:
Called the company because ac unit fan wasn’t blowing. When the owner got out of his truck he was already discussing a new ac unit. Kept stating unit old r22 Freon is not made anymore and is $150+ per lb. After I told him we weren’t interested in a $7600 unit he was done talking. Asked how much would it be to fix the fan since he stated fan motor was no good. He said $700+ and he’ll have to take it off to send to shop. Next day I call another company. They replaced the capacitor and fan started back working. Changed out the hard start because it was no good. Now the ac unit is working great!

Update:
Office manager Alica reach out regarding the issue I had with the service I received. She was very pleasant, thoughtful, and very understanding. She went above and beyond to resolve the issue. I’m happy with the outcome! Thank you Alica

name: kimberly howard
text: Let's just say I won't be calling them back to repair my air-conditioner,

name: Kayleigh Bishop
text: We tried for a week to get a response back from the people who installed our unit 4 years ago with no luck! Alabama Cooling and Heating responded within hours!!!! And repaired our unit quickly! They helped us use the warranty on our unit, that they didn't even install!!!!

name: Adam Lawson
text: I called them they were very polite and courteous and I had someone at my house within the hour looking at my problem they told us what was wrong with it and how much it would cost to fix and they had the problem fixed in under 24 hours and they subtracted the the consultation fee out of the total cost of the repair to make it a little cheaper on me and my family which was extremely helpful thank you all so much coming out here and getting things done so quickly if I have another AC problem I will definitely be using them again also their consultation fee was $5 cheaper than the other place I originally called so the cheaper consultation fee and their speed of service getting out here to tell me what the problem was is exactly why I chose to go with them and I'm not disappointed that I did ; we called them on Friday afternoon and Saturday morning we had cool air they were also very informative and knowledgeable they shared all the information with me and my husband to help us understand exactly what was going on with our air conditioning unit they also informed us of some other things about our central heater and our Freon tank and when our unit was the created how long it's supposed to last; they really filled us in and updated us on a lot useful information about our unit that we didn't know anything about and that will be very helpful to us in the future our central unit is very old about 15 years old and I had to go all the way to Birmingham to get the part for our old unit and I still had our AC fixed under 24 hours I'm sure for anyone out there that has an AC that's 10 years or younger they'll be even faster for y'all and I were exceptionally fast I called 3 places and they were the fastest with a real-time estimate of exactly what time they could be there to look at my AC and they were at my house 30 mins after i initially called them and asked them to come out anyways thank you for fixing our unit and to everyone out there reading this review if you're looking for a good AC company this one's a great one

name: Lisa Parton
text: Excellent customer service from the entire team! We received extraordinarily prompt response & super quick resolution to our problem.  The administrative staff, the service technicians, and the owner were ALL so professional, and yet also made us feel like old friends! We were able to make a very informed decision with superior guidance.  Can't say enough about how great our experience working with this company was! We would recommend them highly for all of your heating & cooling needs!   Lisa & Patrick Parton

name: Kathy Gwizdala
text: We recently had Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning install a Generac Generator for our home on Mobile Bay. We are so very happy with our overall experience with this company. In fact (no lie) less than two hours after the final hook-up, there was a sudden storm, the electricity went out and the generator came on. It was seamless!!! We did have a misunderstanding with the salesman but once we brought it to the attention of Steve Dukes, the business owner, he quickly and decisively took care of it. Because we are on the Bay, we wanted the generator elevated so that, should there be flooding, the generator would be safe. That request hadn't been conveyed to the installers. However, when Mr. Dukes was made aware of the oversight, he actually constructed a metal stand for us himself. Plus he did this very quickly so that the delay was minimal. We were thinking they would build us a wooden platform, but the metal one is much better — both functionally (as it will last longer) and aesthetically. We are from Michigan and we had no intention of being here through hurricane season but we had traveled here with my 94 year old mother and, because of the coronavirus, she couldn’t fly back and she can’t physically tolerate such a long drive.  I was afraid that, because of the misunderstanding, we would be relegated to the bottom of the list and have to wait until they could “get around to it” because they were so busy...not so! There was only a slight delay while the frame was fabricated. So, fast forward to the present time: We had “bugged out” when Hurricane Sally was about 100 miles South of us and just now walked into the door after Sally had passed through. There is no electricity on either side of us but we walked into the door with the generator humming reassuringly beside the house. I don’t have to worry about Moms Bi-Pap or oxygen condenser working. She will be able to sleep comfortably tonight...and so will I. Mr. Dukes made sure we had the generator installed the way we wanted it and in a timely manner, smoothing out the bumps along the way. I definitely recommend getting a whole house (Generac) generator and I highly recommend doing business with Mr. Dukes of Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning. He knows his business and is a man of integrity.

resp.text: Kathy thank you so much. It was a pleasure working with you.

name: Carrie Andrews
text: My  elderly fathers air conditioner went out suddenly and he called Baldwin Heating & Air Conditioning for the first time. When the mechanic arrived he immediatly started in on a sales pitch saying the three year old a/c was not worth repairing due to its age. He wasted over thirty minutes at $100.00 an hour trying to sell us on a new unit  before he even took his tools out of his truck. After one hour into the diagnosis he tells us he needs a part and will return shortly and he leaves. We wait without a/c for over two hours for him to run to get the parts. When he returns he quickly replaces what he calls the capacitor. We had to pay $685.50 for the total repair, $125.00 of which was the part When we were cleaning up his mess we found the reciept from Solar Supply for the part he purchased. That $125.00 part cost them $6.20 , The mechanic also charged us for four pounds of freon and he never even removed the freon caps from the a/c. I feel violated and would not recommend this company to my worst enemy. I will be calling the BBB

name: Judson E Crump
text:
A bit disappointing.  3 months ago, our AC unit wasn't cooling as well as it should.  So we called Baldwin HVAC.  They sent a guy to come out and look at it.  He looked briefly at the unit, walked around the house for a few minutes with a thermometer, and quickly pronounced that there was nothing wrong, and that all we needed was to change our air filters.  So they charged us $39 for the visit (the fee they quote you) plus $50 for "labor," which I guess is that guy's rate for walking around your house for 10 minutes.

Obviously, I keep my filters changed, so I was suspicious, but I assumed that he knew what he was talking about.  2 weeks ago, our AC stops working completely.   Before calling anyone, I go into the attic and check it out myself.  The coils were completely frozen.  And not only that - they were clogged with dust and mold.  This was due to our blower motor malfunctioning, which had been happening slowly for some time at that point.

I took a photo to show how bad it was.  Naturally, I called Baldwin HVAC to ask how their guy missed something so obvious.  The manager, Anthony, said that the initial $89 visit "didn't include" looking at the coils, even though it took me - an ordinary guy with no HVAC expertise - literally 5 minutes to open up the blower and look in there.

Like an fool, I believed him, and so hired them to come out and fix the blower motor that had gone bad.  Their guy John came and he was nice and did a good job.

But the next day, the same AC unit goes dead again.  This time, the problem is the outdoor compressor.  So I call them to come check it out.

They charge us yet another $89 to come and look at the same AC system they'd worked on the very day before.  This time, we resist their high-pressure sales tactics ("It's 4 PM, so if you want the AC working tomorrow, we need to order the part now! ") and call a different company to work on the compressor.  Baldwin HVAC quoted us $822 to replace the part (which was covered by warranty).  We went to Climatemp instead, and they charged us $550 for the exact same job.  They got the part that same day and had a guy out there the very next morning.

Long story short: I'd recommend someone else first, if only because these people charge more than other companies, and in my experience, the quality of the work just wasn't sufficient to justify the extra cost.

We finally found this out after calling another company to fix their problem. They told us they charged twice as much as they would of charged for the same system. They also told us that Trane has been having problems with there compressors since they have been bought out by ingersoll rand. We wished we would have knew this before. Buyers beware the Trane product is nothing like it use to be and this company can care less after they collect the check. There's better companies that actually stand behind their products and work out there.

text: We bought a Trane unit from these guys with nothing but problems. From the first night it was installed it would not cool properly. We called them to come back out the following morning they didn't show up to that afternoon to only tell us some part failed in the coil.  I said this is a brand new unit why would a part fail in one day. They said they have been having this problem with the trane units the sales man Dan never told us that while he was selling us the unit. On top of all of this it took a week to get us the part from Trane to fix my brand new unit. Evidently Trane has a problem there brand new units quit working before they ever even get started and you can't get parts for them in a timely manner. We will never buy another Trane!!! And we will never do business with Baldwin again do to selling us something they knew had a problem!!!

name: Annie Klassen
text:
First, Recently moved to Tuscaloosa and hired this company based on their good reviews.
I would not hire this company. Just called for tune up and they said I needed repairs totaling $800 including parts...on a new unit. I’m a female who does her homework, called a reputable company to check. After their inspection, they said there was no mechanical issues. They put in 2lbs of Freon because someone hadn’t capped it.  They also mentioned they no one from Adams even took the cover off the unit, which I can attest to because I was standing there, but know nothing about HVAC. Buyer beware.

resp.text: Sorry about your experience in using us! My technicians are very well trained to check over your system and look for any problems with your system. If you had to add 2 lbs of refrigerant to your system, then you have a leak that wouldn't be fixed by simply caps. That is just a short term solution to your problem. We offered the long term fix for around $500, not $800. If the parts weren't under warranty would of cost you over $1500 to repair properly. Unfortunately, Newer units fail all the time. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to earn your business!

I am now a lifetime customer and wouldn't recommend any other company.

Some distributors even charge us a fee to fill the warranty with them. Which is pretty unfair too. I wish it was different. Sorry! We really appreciate your Business!! I hope this one thing doesn't change from you using us again. We really try to be honest and fair!

text: Cannot say enough positive things about this company! Our air went on the fritz 2 weeks ago due to a bad freon leak. Richard came out same day  to check on the issue and gave us our options. Richard came out and filled our unit with freon to get us through the baby shower and then they began work the next week installing a complete new unit, furnace and duct work. They are VERY ACCOMMODATING with schedules, and they communicate often and effectively. We know nothing about heating and cooling lingo and what's good and what's bad, and their crew explained everything they were going to do and why. Adams is trustworthy, and their work is honest, cost efficient, and clean as can be. They even swept and vacuumed after they finished each day!

resp.text: Sorry for the delay to respond to this. I couldn't tell you how great it is to have someone leave such a great review! I really do take pride over customer service. I feel like it is going away more and more. We try to hold a standard here. I preach it everyday! Thank you again for this review! This is why we are in business. To help people.

name: Sam Lowry
text: I was given an estimate to replace the inside and outside unit, as well as all ductwork. What I actually needed was just the outside unit and repair the existing ductwork. Inside unit is new and ductwork isn't in bad shape, just a few simple repairs. I don't recommend them unless you want an estimate that is more than 2.5x what is actually needed. Waste of time.

resp.text: Sorry you feel it was a waste of time! With new refrigerant, we can't just replace the outside unit anymore. With the duct work, must of been a lot more issues than what you thought you had. More than 50% of existing homes  have improperly sized duct work. Which could be the cause of your outside unit being bad. We don’t look for the temporary fix but the permanent one. There was issues we saw that suggested replacing the duct and system to get your home properly heating and cooling. Thank you for the chance to earn your business!

name: J K
text:
I needed to get my air conditioning system repaired.  So I called several HVAC companies, and I quickly found out that the repair cost was high enough that I was better off getting a new air conditioning system. So I did some research, and then I got quotes from 11 different companies. Of the price range of quotes, Xcalibur was among the lowest. So I chose Xcalibur, and the next morning, Ryan, Mark, Jacob and Zachary showed up and installed a new air conditioning system and furnace (I actually didn't need a new furnace, but the extra cost to add a new furnace to the a/c installation job was low.).  The installation guys were professional (for example, they put on shoe covers before entering my house) and knowledgeable.

I'm glad that I chose this company. First, Ben and Ryan are actually honest people. Also, Ben and his employees seem to take pride in doing a good job.  My new a/c system not only comes with the standard 10 year warranty for parts, but also a 10 year warranty for LABOR.  Call other HVAC companies yourself and ask if they include a 10 year labor warranty on a/c installations.  When they say no, ask them what the labor cost is to replace a compressor or an evaporator coil.  Also, Xcalibur installed new line sets with my a/c system. But some HVAC companies cut corners by not installing new line sets.

Since Alabama Power is my electricity company, I can track my electricity usage via Alabama Power's website or their app. My new Bryant a/c system uses about 39% less kilowatts than the American Standard system that it replaced.  In just the first month of using this Bryant a/c system, I saved over $100 on my Alabama Power bill!  I also found out that Bryant equipment and Carrier equipment come out of the same factories because they are sister companies.

If I could give Xcalibur 6 stars, I would. But Google only allows me to give 5 stars.

By Saturday morning, I had an email from Ben that said he emailed, rather than called, to avoid disrupting my Saturday morning, but that he was available to schedule my service when I was ready. He made my appointment for Tuesday morning, only two business days later.

As promised, the technician, Zack, called before he headed my way. He arrived at the promised time and was just as efficient throughout the appointment. Zack showed me where my dryer duct ran to and explained what he was going to do. The vent hose on my machine was much longer than necessary, so he offered to trim it to reduce the possibility of it getting bunched up and causing additional issues. Zack was finished within an hour of his arrival and happy to answer my questions.

Xcalibur is fairly priced and competent. I will call Ben and his crew again.

text:

Not only did they provide the most comprehensive evaluation and options for repair or replacement - their prices were much lower than the four other estimates I received. I called all of the other big players in the Anniston/Oxford/Jacksonville area and I knew these were the right folks to fix the problem. They even came back out after fixing my HVAC system and helped me install a thermostat free of charge. They are very honest and knowledgeable and give you facts before you make a decision.

This is a Veteran owned business and I support our Veterans both in business and any other way I can, so it was a perfect fit for me.

My current unit may last for a few more years, but when I need a new one, I know exactly who to call!

If you are searching for a solid company to install and take care of your HVAC needs, stop searching and just call them up. text: Wow.  I called late in the evening when my air went out.  Jason answered and walked me thru a possible fix. He was very polite, professional, walked me thru everything he did, and gave maintenance suggestions to help avoid my issue in the future.  This type of business model has been lost by most businesses.  Upfront, Honest, Helpful.  An outstanding concept of informing the customer of options and help without trying to gouge the customer for every dime.  Based on this model, you can bet they will be the first company I call when I need a replacement or any service.   Based on my experience, Don't hesitate to call these guys.

I wore a N95 mask during his service call.  The risk of transmission would have been lower if we both had worn masks.

resp.text: Thank you for your review Troy! Our number one objective is our customers comfort and safety so thank you for bringing this to my attention. We provide all our technicians with masks and I can assure you they will be wearing one for you at our next visit. Merry Christmas!!

We were able to pay them with our credit card when they finished.  The price was competitive.  Overall a very professional and easy process.  I highly recommend Turner & Schoel!

name: Therese Culliton
text: The service technician that came out the day before we had to have a new unit put in was extremely professional and took the time to explain what was going on with our current system and why it needed to be replaced.  I never felt that he was rushing us as he was very patient and wanted to make sure everything was explained very well.  He went further to explain that the next day they would arrive with the new unit at a certain time.  At that time, he and two other techs arrived and removed the other system again further explaining every step.  Once the new unit arrived, I was told that a Quality Control person would also be coming to inspect what was going on!  I was so impressed with this and had not seen this before.  The Quality Control guy went top to bottom over this entire unit throughout the installation process.  The professionalism of the three techs and the Quality Control man was absolutely first rate!  I will highly recommend this Company to all my friends and coworkers.  After all was said and done, I felt like I was the most important customer they had had that day.  Thanks, again, to all of you for an incredible experience!

resp.text: Therese, it was our pleasure to take care of your heating & cooling needs! We certainly appreciate your business. Thanks again...

name: Tim Caudill
text:
After suffering a power outage late Saturday night, we woke on Sunday morning to a dead heat pump. I called Turner and Schoel expecting either a "Our office hours are Monday through Friday" or "Please leave a message". Instead, I was greeted with an answering service that took my information and said a technician would contact me shortly. Within 20 minutes I received a call. ON A SUNDAY!!!! The technician asked me a few questions and said he would be at my home shortly. ON A SUNDAY!!!!
The technician, Jordan Cribb, arrived within the hour. He went about diagnosing and repairing my unit while keeping me informed of everything he was doing. While here, he was very courteous and professional and I couldn't have asked for a better service technician.

This was my first experience with Turner and Schoel, but it will not be my last. They just made a me a customer for life.

resp.text: Mr. Caudill, thank you for these kind words. We are thankful for all our customers and love showing off our service to “first timers “. We appreciate your business! Glad to be there for you.

ALL T&S employees were polite and professional in every way. I've lived here for over 25 years and I really believe T&S set a new bar for residential service that I haven't seen in this town. As you can imagine, we were absolutely astounded that they could send someone out that same night to see what the problem was. Soon after Jack arrived, he was able to repair our A/C that same night, and we slept well knowing that our A/C was back up and running. text: Turner & schoel changed out a 4ton gas heat & AC. unit on my mom's house. 10000. Yes friends they ripped off my elderly mom and dad (80&85). These people are thieves. And tipoff attest. I now have proof of there thievery. I took a picture of the tag on this hamana.(Goodman) unit and took it around for estimates..... Hulsey 6700$..... Premier 7510$.... A1 Alabama 6450$.... Turner& Schoel. 8990$..... yes Turner and schoel bid the same 10000$ job 8990$. 1000$ cheeper than what they charged my mother.... by there own bid they are thieves..... but after talking to Bobby at A1.Alabama. they should have used them.... and as far as not being able to buy a hamana from Amazon. That's all you can buy from Amazon.  Goodman bought hamana in 1997. So dont be fooled by these fast talking con men thieves.... they are good at the con man fast talk. CON. yes you read this right. Mom paid 10000$. And they later bid the same job. 8990$ a full 1000$ cheeper witch is still 3000$ high... BEWARE THESE THIEVES.

resp.text:
Gary,

Your recent review has caused us great concern. I personally reached out to both of your parents to schedule a meeting and discuss their recent service in person. They assured me that they are completely satisfied with the system they selected and the service provided, and asked for assurance that we would continue to take care of their preventative maintenance. It will be our pleasure to continue working with your parents, as one of our highly valued customers.

I also wish to share with you that the system your parents purchased is not available on Amazon. The 16 SEER Amana system includes a 2-stage variable speed gas furnace. Both units come with a lifetime replacement guarantee, and the entire system is covered by a 10-year parts and labor warranty.

If you wish to discuss this matter further, please do not hesitate to contact us directly.

text:
First of all I would never buy a Trane unit. The experience I have had with this product has been a nightmare to say the least. Secondly, Turner and Schoel has done nothing, zero, nada in terms of helping me to be a satisfied customer with this piece of crap. After several years and several thousands of dollars (after my intiail investment) they finally said the coils needed to be replaced. This was another $3,600 last June. Replaced them with aluminum coils because they are suppose to be better and now one year and 3 weeks later I have a leak. Of course it is again out of warranty.

I have had another technician (from a much more reputable business) to come out and say that the unit was undersized and the duct work to two rooms was poorly done. If the only two companies in the world to make AC/heating units were Dynex and Trane and the only two companies in the world to install them were Turner and Schoels and WalMart I would have WalMart install a Dynex every day of the week.

name: William Livingston
text: Jack Humphries is real professional  and knowledgble.

name: A.J. Tosyali
text:
I have had several dealings with TS heating and cooling and most of which has been fair thanks to their previous manager Aubrey. I was always treated well by Aubrey and he always made me feel like an important customer no matter how little business I've previously done with them.

The last job they did for me was a follow up to trying to eliminate a drip sound that could constantly be heard in my bedroom anytime the heat came on. After several attempts, Aubrey felt badly enough that he said he was going to try something so miniscule that it may just work and he said he'd charge me nothing for it since they'd already charged me for a previous visit.

Well, they billed me for it anyway....not a big deal being $75 and given that I've paid them thousands over the last few years. However when I called the owner, Phillip, today he could have cared less about past business or future business and simply said that he was certain I was mistaken and I owed the money, as if I'd try to beat them out of $75.  I thought I was on candid camera based on the way an owner of a company could have cared less about one of his customers and the lecture he tried to give me about business. It was not worth the headache to fight over $75 but the way they made me feel and the fact that they would not honor a prior commitment was truly an unpleasant experience.

The lady that answers the phone is very nonchalant, the workers are rude, there isn’t any type of greeting when you get to this place, this place is a 0/10 never bring your car here unless you have another at home you can drive until yours get fixed and i’m paying these people almost 2 thousand dollars on something they haven’t even started on yet.

Can I ask that you please call me personally at 205-786-8279? I want you to know I am very sorry about this and  interested in listening to what happened directly from you. Please call me.

Thank you, Mr T!

resp.text: Thank you, Jonathan for taking the time to leave us a review! We're always happy to help a lending hand to customers in need, as we know how scary and frustrating a situation like that can be. Thank you again for your kind words, and for visiting Mr. T's Automotive!

name: Sharlene Brown
text: Received car back with missing parts, drove car home and parked it.  Two days later drove it and it broke down while driving it after I paid $1700.00 for it to be repaired. Was told it was the engine why wasn't that found when the $1700.00 work was done?????

resp.text: Thank you Sharlene for taking the time to leave us your feedback! On April 4th we put a rack and pinion steering sector and a power steering pump on your car. Your timing chain broke, there is no way to predict that the timing chain is going to break. It is always a good idea to replace it when recommended by the manufacturer so that it doesn't break and destroy the motor.

name: Pam Steele
text: I am at Mr T’s shop with my daughter and the manner of communication given to my daughter by an employee was unprofessional i.e. talking about her hair and children; stating that he understands why her hair is “glued on” since she has so many children. when we returned immediately after picking up her car because of engine light being on he stated well you might as well get it fixed too since you have your income tax money......very rude and appears to have an set opinion of certain people. Know this; all people of color are not ignorant to employee’s or employers who  apparently  do not have their facts or business etiquette in order. We are waiting outside over an hour for wiring to sensor to correct check engine light. I have had to cancel my business appointments today by the way is how we paid for this fiasco. Such a bad way to earn business from customers however they choose to pay

resp.text: Ms Grant, I am very sorry that you were offended that certainly was not my intention. Let me first say that I am not a racist person, my business would not have survived 30 plus years in a predominately black community if I was. I try to treat my customers like family or at  least like a close friend without the thought that some people may take offense to it. I often come into the lobby and interact with my customers, mostly to let them know they are more to me than just a dollar. I believe that most appreciate that or I wouldn't have been here as long as I have. My business is built on word of mouth from family member to family member, friends to friends then coworkers and others. I know the majority of my customers by name, I know their spouses, mothers and fathers, sisters and brothers and their children. Again, I apologize for offending you and I truly hope that I have not lost your daughters business through this misunderstanding.

name: christopher mennefield
text: Best mechanic in the south

resp.text: That means the world to us, Christopher! Thank you again for the 5-stars and for making Mr. T's Automotive your go-to automotive repair shop! We'll see you next time!

name: Brenda Jackson
text: WOW!!! I must tell about my wonderful experience with this place. I was greeted with a smile. The young lady was very polite and listened to my concerns, and got my car looked at by the owner quickly. I explained to her that I was having back surgery the next day and would bring my car by to get the needed repairs. The young lady , Stephanie typed me an estimate with needed repairs and the amounts of them so I could give my husband. She called me to let me know my car was ready and then helped me and my husband make payment (he was in another state at this time). The process was so smooth she was so helpful and concerned. To top it off when I came to pick up my car, I was greeted by that wonderful smile again and she pulled my car to the front and helped me in. Thank You, Thank You Stephanie and Mr. Ts, I have never received this multitude of service from a repair shop! Best experience ever, I will be back and sending you more business!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5-star review Ms. Jackson, and for your business. Also, thank you for recognizing one of our employees! We will let Stephanie know what a great job she's doing.

name: Antonio Gulley
text: I have a 2008 white Dodge Charger MR T’s put a motor in my car and a  Coolant reservoir total $4100.00 he told me the new motor they put in my car had 18  Thousand miles  wow that’s a new.the car was driving nice and  smooth.but after two weeks of driving  my check engine light came on and the car start shaking real bad and    Running rough. I never had a car with 18 thousand miles on it running rough or all the cars I rented with 18 thousand miles on it running rough like this. So I called him and told him what the problem was and they told me to bring it up there So I drop the car off Wednesday late evening by the way I stayed about 12 miles away but when I was driving to the shop it wasn’t running rough anymore. So I called him and told him what was going on with the car again he told me to bring it back up there again Monday ..  they are very nice he is not give me any problems about bringing my car back up there but I just want my car fixed  so I will keep you guys posted with this review after I pick my car up after Monday  to be continued...

name: Doyle Bright
text:
Mr T's automotive strives to satisfy the customer Matt Tortorici is very knowledgeable he has been working with cars and building engines from back in the mid 70's .  I had a coolant leakage problem with my GMC 1500 Sierria 5.3 liter Truck.  GM used defective castech heads casting#706 from 2002 thru 2007 they were made in China. The heads will crack at the head bolts causing coolant to leak into engine. GM would not fix the Issue and had multiple other shops in the Birmingham area try and repair the same old casting 706 and it would last for around 60k miles and crack again.  We put casting 243 heads on my 2002 5.3 liter
and so far so good it seems to have lost little low end but picked up some upper end power. Matt went over everything with me and even steamed cleaned my engine also repaired my AC.  I highly recommend Mr T's / Matt Tortorici he didi exceleent job on my Truck.. MShelto

When this issue was presented to the business owner instead of him treating a paying consumer with respect, I was met with, anger, frustration, he himself had a lack of understanding, unwillingness to explain, lack of empathy. resp.text:
Do you know the legal liability you have imposed on yourself by posting a malicious business review with a fake Google account? You should look it up. With that said here is our reply to your review.
I am sorry you are having an issue after the repair but an engine replacement is just that, the engine along with any extra parts that we felt were questionable and they are listed on your invoice. There is not an ECM on your invoice. Please keep in mind that there are several other things under the hood of your car that can also cause future problems. Unfortunately we are not able to detect a component such as an ECM, starter, alternator, Oxygen Sensor, Injector and so on that is about to go bad, it is just impossible. Your vehicle is 11 years old and does have 175,000 miles on and usually parts and components will begin to fail and need replacing after 10 years. This ECM is not covered under warranty because we did not replace this part and it does not come with an engine. I have copied and pasted some information for you that came from a site called my mechanic explaining the ECM’s function to your car. We have ordered the ECM, as you know, and as soon as it is installed and the car is test drove we will call you.
Here is some information that I pulled from the site "My Mechanic" that may help you better understand an ECM's function.
The engine control module (ECM), also commonly referred to as the engine control unit (ECU) or powertrain control module (PCM), is one of the most important components found on virtually all  vehicles. It essentially functions as the main computer for many of the vehicle’s engine performance and drivability functions. The ECM takes the information from the engine's various sensors and uses that information to calculate and tune engine spark and fuel for maximum power and efficiency. Erratic engine behavior also indicates a bad or failing ECM. A faulty computer may cause the vehicle to intermittently stall or misfire. The symptoms might come and go and not appear to have any sort of pattern to their frequency or severity. The ECM plays a vital role in engine performance. Any issues with it can cause major problems with the overall functionality of the car.

name: Soul Jah
text:
WARNING! WARNING! ...Avoid at all cost!! This business is not what they claim they are. My P30 Step Van was towed in to get a refreshing and almost had to be towed away. I heard their ad on the radio, gave them a call and found out they service Cintas vans. I spoke to the owner Matt on the phone and he assured me that he was the place to come to and he would take care of me. I told him what I wanted done, I also left a list with the most important to be taken care of first (fuel tank leak and master cylinder replacement) with the receptionist. I mentioned new tires but didn’t decide what to install, but he did, and installed them without my consent. Later he said he thought that’s what I wanted “the cheap ones.” He decided to do what he wanted and void my concerns (that I spoke of on every visit). I was charged over $400.00 in parts (radiator, v belt and lug nuts) plus labor @ $74/hour added without my consent nor were they spoken of when I made payments in person. I was charged ($35.00) for an air cleaner that he had left from a previous vehicle and promised that he wouldn’t charge me for since I was getting so much work done. That Monday of week three, I stopped by to realize no work had been done over the past 5 days and I immediately stopped the work and told them I would be back in the morning to pick up and pay off balance. Next morning I waited over and hour for the motor to be pressure washed like he promised it would be done yesterday by lunch. While waiting he then decided that he would for free replace the master cylinder and patch the fuel tank leak with a $6.00 putty instead of replacing the tank like I asked on day one. All while repairs being done there were no actual receipt/list of parts and labor but guesstimations made until I made final payment. After I reviewed the receipt just before I paid the remaining $1,400+ balance I had to request that Matt break down and fix the double charges on receipt (I was so angry that I missed a few issues on the receipt). A week turned into a month and if I had not stopped the work there’s no telling how long it would have taken to get the van back. Now I’m weeks behind schedule on preparing for the van for body work and getting it wrapped.   The total cost was $3,863.68 and $1,417.25 of it was labor. I felt robbed and played. This place is not worthy of your money and will waste your time…. so please be advised! You are WARNED!!
CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS CROOKS

H Russell Adair II
White 1984 Chevrolet P30 Step Van

P.S.
I was charged $30.00 for brake fluid even though he knew the master cylinder was bad. I realized this after I paid. Also, the paper work was drawn up and balance paid before he decided to replace master cylinder.
Matt told me the only man allowed to work on my vehicle had taken off several days due to court date and illness hence why the time frame was pushed back.
He spoke negatively about customers in front of me while they were on hold with the receptionist who also was not professional.

text: We’ve used Service Tech for our home and business since 1995. Our A/C unit reached the end of its life late on a Friday. The owner, Richie Vines, was here by 8am Saturday morning, two hours after we called. He got our unit working in 95 degree weather till we were able to replace it. We worked with sales, Steve Burns, who gave us numerous options for replacement. The installation technicians, Robert and Von, were incredibly professional and knowledgeable. We replaced both our A/C and furnace with Trane equipment. It’s completely solved our problem of hearing 2 floors with only 1 unit. The thermostat works from either the control pad or an app. Everyone in our family is really happy with the results and the service was outstanding!

resp.text: We are so glad that everyone in your family is happy. We will let Robert & Von know how well they did, as well as the owner Richie Vines. Service Tech, Inc. really values your feedback and looks forward to continuing the great relationship that we have established over the years. Warm regards, Team Service Tech, Inc.

name: George Stewart
text: I had my two heating systems inspected and maintained by a Service Tech technician. He brought with him a new preventive maintenance system with temperature meters that attached to return and supply registers which would feed an analysis software app on his phone and prepare a report for me. I have not yet received this report but was told that my cooling systems were okay ( not sure why this was done this time of year). He also told me that my upstairs thermostat was not working properly in heat mode and thought it might need to be replaced. I pointed out to him that is recently replaced as new in June 2020 and said that it was installed by my son at that time. We looked at the installation and he discovered that a wire jumper that powers the heating mode was missing. After helping him by holding a light to illuminate the terminal strip, he installed the jumper and the thermostat heating system came on.

resp.text: Thank you George for your review.  We appreciate your business.  Please contact us if you have any other issues.

name: robert bashinsky
text: The work was good and results were satisfactory. The crew was to rip out the damaged duct work, replace it and clean the HVAC unit. This was done, but the only complaints I had were they did not cover the vents and returns before the removal of the old moldy ducts. Thus the rooms became full of a moldy smell. They did stop and come cover the vents and returns, but they did not have any painters tape to apply to the walls. Fortunately I had some painters tape to loan to them. Other than those two lapses I had no complaints. The foreman was courteous and helpful and I would use Service Tech again if needed.

resp.text: Mr. Bashinsky, we apologize that we failed to cover the vents and returns initially. We are fortunate that you loaned us your painters tape. Team work makes the dream work, right??! Our team will pass this information on so that we have all of the supplies we need in the future. Your feedback has been quite helpful and we look forward to a continued business relationship with you. Sincerely, Team Service Tech, Inc.
